title: Dubai Central Library
content:
''' Dubai Central Library ''' is a [[library]] to be built in [[Al Mamzar]] locality of [[Dubai]], [[UAE]].
The library is expected to contain more than 1.7 million [[books]].  The unique design of the library is inspired by the shape of a Turkish lectern. The main features of this library will be, a [[Meeting|conference centre]], [[exhibition]] spaces, children's library, bookshop on the ground floor reading halls, service areas, business library, and training halls.The basement of the library will be able to accommodate as many as 1,000 [[cars]].  

The project is currently in design process, with the construction is expected to begin later this year and the library will be completed by the end of next year.<ref>http://gulfbusiness.com/2013/07/dubai-plans-new-mini-world-park-central-library/#.UgYGIawlHSc</ref><ref>http://mapolis.com/en/building/Dubai_Central_Library#!wall</ref><ref>http://www.asp-stuttgart.de/index2.php?lan=en&n=2&s=1&d=1&id=35&type=&site=http%3A//www.asp-stuttgart.de/asp_content.php%3Flan%3Den%26n%3D2%26s%3D1%26d%3D1%26id%3D35</ref> 300,000 to 400,000 volumes will be available in the library's open-access section. The library will have Book handling and information systems. Library has been designed by consortium of 'asp' Architekten Stuttgart, Obermeyer Planen+Beraten Munich and ACG Architecture Consulting Group.
In the meantime options are discussed of relocating the building site from the initially proposed location at Lake Al-Mamzar to the prestigious Business Bay in downtown Dubai which indeed would be a suitable location for a cultural institution of this scale.<ref>http://www.asp-stuttgart.de/index2.php?lan=en&n=2&s=1&d=1&id=35&type=&site=http%3A//www.asp-stuttgart.de/asp_content.php%3Flan%3Den%26n%3D2%26s%3D1%26d%3D1%26id%3D35</ref>

title: Talk:Akorha
User:Davidpstewart
content:
===Dundee Roadrunners AC=== [[File:Dundee_roadrunners_discovery1.jpg|thumb|alt=Alt text|Discovery Point, Dundee]] [http://www.dundeeroadrunners.co.uk Dundee Roadrunners]is an non-elite amateur athletics running club affiliated to [http://www.scottishathletics.org.uk Scottish Athletics] [http://www.scottishathletics.org.uk/index.php?p=23 Scottish Athletics Affiliates], National Registering Organisation.. The club is based in the city of [[Dundee|Dundee]] [http://www.dundeecity.gov.uk/orgs/group.php?id=427 Dundee City Sports Council], Local Registering Organisation., situated on the north-east coast of Scotland in the UK. Its philosophy is of friendly participation in running for fitness health and social benefit rather than a primary orientation towards competition. ==History== Dundee Roadrunners was formed in 1984, and its members have been active participants in the sport of running in its various disciplines since that date. The club celebrated it's twenty fifth anniversary in 2009. The club grew out of a group of runners from Valentine's Greetings Cards led by a runner named Dave Roy. The stimulus for this development was running boom of the mid 80s and specifically the second Dundee marathon of that year. By 1985 a membership of 180 runners was recorded rising to 250 the following year. Numbers have declined since that peak but remain healthy with lady runners particularly well represented. Originally based at Lochee Baths in Dundee the club now is meets at [http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=energie,+main+street+dundee&sll=56.457117,-3.119206&sspn=0.00709,0.022724&g=main+street+dundee&ie=UTF8&hq=energie,&hnear=Main+St,+Longforgan,+Dundee,+DD2,+UK&ll=56.47195,-2.981501&spn=0.014175,0.045447&z=15 Energie], a gym on Main Street in central Dundee. The club has enjoyed much competitive success in both men and ladies' events over many years but remains committed catering for runners of all levels. The club has had strong links with Laufgemeinschaft [[Würzburg|Würzburg]] since 1986 through Dundee's twinning with this city, and many reciprocal visits have occurred over the years. ==Activities== The club meets every Tuesday and Thursday evening through-out the year at Energie on Main Street. On Tuesdays group runs over 6,8,and 10 miles start at 6.30pm. The club actively recruits new members throught the year and invites any runner interested in running to join these activities without any requirement to join the club formally. In the winter months these runs offer the safely of running in groups on well lit routes. During the summer runs extend to the pleasant hinterland outwith the city , and once a month these runs begin at Clatto Park a country park on the fringes of the town. On Thursdays the members of the club meet for specific training sessions led by the club coaches, which may consists of interval training, hill sessions, or speed drills. Runners within the club run mostly on the road, but actively train and complete in Cross Country and Hill Running, with a number of members also involved in duathlon, triathlon and adventure racing. ==Club Open Races Races== The club organises two open races every year. :'''1. Templeton 10 Mile Road Race''' :This popular open event is held on the first Sunday in November and has attracted runners of all standards including former World 10000m champion [[Liz McColgan|Liz McColgan]] through to casual fun runners over the years. It is for many runners the last big event of the season and usually attracts a field of about 350-400 participants. It begins and ends around [http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=clatto+park+dundee&sll=53.800651,-4.064941&sspn=15.56051,46.538086&ie=UTF8&hq=clatto+park&hnear=Dundee,+UK&ll=56.514806,-3.022614&spn=0.113272,0.363579&z=12&iwloc=A Clatto Country Park]. The course is scenic and hilly, providing a real test of personal commitment and excellent post race hospitality.
:'''2. Whitetops Hill race''' :[[File:Whitetops_race_1.JPG|thumb|alt=Alt text|Waiting for the gun, Whitetops]] This race is held on the last Thursday of June, and is a hill race aimed at the novice hill runner. It is part of the [http://www.shr.uk.com/Home.aspx Scottish Hill Runners] calendar and consists of a 10k run and a 274m climb. Race registration is at Kirkton of Auchterhouse School, but the race starts and finishes at [http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=old+balkello++dundee&sll=56.497186,-3.001328&sspn=0.113325,0.363579&ie=UTF8&hq=old+balkello&hnear=Dundee,+UK&ll=56.513859,-3.029652&spn=0.113275,0.363579&z=12t Old Balkello Woods]. The entry is usually around 30-40 runners of all standards. ==Club Championships== The club organises a number of internal competitions. :'''1. Spring and Autumn Handicaps''' :These are two short races around the Nature Trail at [http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=camperdown+park+dundee&sll=53.800651,-4.064941&sspn=15.56051,46.538086&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=Camperdown+Park,+Dundee,+Angus+DD24TF,+United+Kingdom&ll=56.484393,-3.04619&spn=0.056682,0.181789&z=13 Camperdown Park]. Runners are given a handicap based on their most recent 10k time with the aim of as many runners as possible finishing at the same time and with an equal chance of winning. The later event in the autumn allows a measure of progress over the season. :'''2. John McInally Trophy''' :This event is a straight 7.5 mile race over quiet country roads held in May for all club members, and was initiated by and named after one of our oldest club members. :'''3. DRR Club Hill Championship''' :This is a shorter vesion of the Whitetops race and begins and ends just off [http://maps.google.co.uk/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=the+brae&sll=56.536299,-3.064156&sspn=0.054238,0.181789&ie=UTF8&radius=3.46&rq=1&ev=zi&hq=the+brae&hnear=&ll=56.536299,-3.064156&spn=0.054238,0.181789&z=13 "The Brae"] in Auchterhouse. ==Social events== The club organises an annual dance, a summer barbecue, with live music and a mini-duathlon, occasional weekend "soup runs" over the winter and fun events throughout the year such as the Twin Peaks and Reindeer Roundup events.

title: Kitano Tenmangū
content:
{{Infobox Shinto shrine | name = Kitano Tenmangū
北野天満宮 | image = Kitano-tenmangu Kyoto Japan41s3s4592.jpg | width = | caption = The ''[[honden]]'', or main building. | type = [[Tenmangū]] | dedication = [[Sugawara no Michizane]] | founded = 947 | closed = | founder = | priest = | reisai = Reitaisai (August 4th) | honden = [[Gongen-zukuri]] | address = Hakuraku-chō, [[Kamigyō-ku, Kyoto]] | latd = 35| latm = 01| lats = 52| latNS =N | longd=135 | longm= 44| longs= 07| longEW=E | iso_region =JP-26 | coordinates_display = title | location_map = Japan | map_caption = Location within Japan | website = http://www.kitanotenmangu.or.jp/ }} '''{{nihongo|Kitano Tenmangū|北野天満宮|}}''' is a [[Shinto shrine]] in [[Kamigyō-ku, Kyoto]], [[Japan]].Richard, Ponsonby-Fane. (1964) '' Visiting Famous Shrines in Japan,'' pp. 194-220. ==History== {{stack| [[File:Plum trees Kitano Tenmangu.jpg|thumb|Two women praying in front of the ''chishusha'' (地主社)]] [[File:Kitano Tenmangu-3849.JPG|thumb|Lanterns hang from the eaves of the main buildings.]] }} The shrine was first built in 947 to appease the angry spirit of bureaucrat, scholar and poet [[Sugawara no Michizane]], who had been exiled as a result of political maneuvers of his enemies in the [[Fujiwara clan]]. The shrine became the object of Imperial patronage during the early [[Heian period]].Breen, John ''et al.'' (2000). [http://books.google.com/books?id=MADlfH002mAC&dq=nijunisha&q=oharano ''Shinto in History: Ways of the Kami,'' pp. 74-75.] In 965, [[Emperor Murakami]] ordered that Imperial messengers be sent to report important events to the guardian ''[[kami]]'' of Japan. These messenger, called ''heihaku'', were initially presented to 16 shrines;Ponsonby-Fane, Richard. (1962). ''Studies in Shinto and Shrines,'' pp. 116-117. and in 991, [[Emperor Ichijō]] added three more shrines to Murakami's list — including Kitano.Ponsonby-Fane, ''Studies in Shrines,'' p. 118. From 1871 through 1946, the Kitano Tenman-gū was officially designated one of the {{nihongo|[[Modern system of ranked Shinto Shrines|''Kanpei-chūsha'']]|官幣中社}}, meaning that it stood in the second rank of government supported shrines.Ponsonby-Fane, Richard. (1959). ''The Imperial House of Japan,'' pp. 126. ==Tenjin== The shrine was dedicated to Michizane; and in 986, the scholar-bureaucrat was deified and the title of "[[Tenjin (kami)|Tenjin]]" was conferred. [[File:Maiko serving tea at Kitano Tenmangū 2011-02-25.jpg|thumb|left|upright|A [[Maiko (geiko)|maiko]] serving tea at the plum blossom festival.]] The grounds are filled with Michizane's favorite tree, the red and white ''[[ume]]'' or plum blossom, and when they blossom the shrine is often very crowded. The Plum Blossom Festival (梅花祭, ''baikasai'') is held on February 25, coinciding with the monthly market. An open-air tea ceremony (野点, ''nodate'') is hosted by [[Geisha|geiko]] and apprentice maiko from the nearby [[Kamishichiken]] district, where tea and [[wagashi]] are served to 3,000 guests by geisha and maiko.[http://www.kyoto.travel/baika-sai_plum_festival.html Baika-sai (Plum Festival)], Kyoto Travel Guide[http://www.kyoto-np.co.jp/kp/topics/eng/2007feb/02-25.html Open-Air Tea Ceremony with the Scent of Plum Blossoms: Plum Blossom Festival at Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine], Kyoto Shimbun, 2007.2.25 The plum festival has been held on the same day every year for about 900 years to mark the death of Michizane. The outdoor tea ceremony dates back to 1952. In that year, a big festival was held to mark the 1,050th anniversary of Michizane's death, based on the historic Kitano Ochakai tea ceremony hosted at the shrine by [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]]. [[File:Tenmangu flea market 25 August 2006.jpg|thumb|The proverbial flea market at Tenmangū]] Kitano Tenmangū is popular with students praying for success in exams because the deity was in his life a man of literature and knowledge. On the 25th of every month, the shrine hosts a [[flea market]]. Together with the similar festival at [[Tō-ji]], a temple in the same city, they inspired the Kyoto proverb, "Fair weather at the Tōji market means rainy weather at the Tenjin market," calling to mind Kyoto's fickle weather. ==See also== * [[List of Shinto shrines]] * [[Twenty-Two Shrines]] * [[List of National Treasures of Japan (shrines)]] * [[List of National Treasures of Japan (paintings)]] * [[Modern system of ranked Shinto Shrines]] * [[Three Great Tenjin Shrines]] ==Notes== {{reflist|2}} ==References== {{Portal|Japan|Shinto|Architecture}} * [[John Breen (scholar)|Breen, John]] and [[Mark Teeuwen]]. (2000). [http://books.google.com/books?id=MADlfH002mAC&dq=nijunisha&source=gbs_navlinks_s ''Shinto in History: Ways of the Kami.''] Honolulu: [[University of Hawaii Press]]. ISBN 978-0-8248-2363-4 * [[Richard Ponsonby-Fane|Ponsonby-Fane, Richard]]. (1962). [http://books.google.com/books?id=tjEvAAAAYAAJ&dq=Studies+in+Shinto+and+Shrines&ei=O6yMSZu3HKD2MsWNhdwC&client=firefox-a ''Studies in Shinto and Shrines.''] Kyoto: Ponsonby Memorial Society. [http://www.worldcat.org/wcpa/oclc/3994492 OCLC 399449] * ____________. (1959). [http://books.google.com/books?id=SLAeAAAAMAAJ&q=The+Imperial+House+of+Japan&dq=The+Imperial+House+of+Japan&client=firefox-a&pgis=1 ''The Imperial House of Japan.''] Kyoto: Ponsonby Memorial Society. [http://www.worldcat.org/wcpa/oclc/194887 OCLC 194887] * ____________. (1964). [http://books.google.com/books?id=_6rXAAAAMAAJ&q=Visiting+famous+shrines+in+japan&dq=Visiting+famous+shrines+in+japan&client=firefox-a ''Visiting Famous Shrines in Japan.''] Kyoto: Ponsonby-Fane Memorial Society. {{OCLC|1030156}} == External links == {{commons category|Kitano-tenmangu}} * [http://kitanotenmangu.or.jp/top_en.php Kitano Tenmangū Official web page] {{en icon}} * [http://www.kyoto-np.co.jp/kp/topics/eng/2007feb/02-25.html Kyoto Shimbun: Open-Air Tea Ceremony...] {{en icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kitano Tenman-Gu}} [[Category:Religious buildings completed in 947]] [[Category:947 establishments]] [[Category:Shinto shrines in Kyoto]] [[Category:Heian period]] [[Category:National Treasures of Japan]] [[Category:Important Cultural Properties of Japan]]

title: Rock 'n Roll Fantasy Camp
content:
{{multiple issues|
{{refimprove|date=October 2012}}
{{COI|date=August 2010}}
}}
{{Infobox recurring event
| name         = Rock 'n Roll Fantasy Camp
| logo         = <!--INCLUDE "[[File:Filename.ext]]" when entering file name-->
| logo_caption =
| image        = <!--DO NOT include "File:" part of image name-->
| imagesize    =

The '''Rock 'n' Roll Fantasy Camp''' is an interactive musical event, that takes place in various coveted locations worldwide involving various Rock Stars on various dates. The events range from one to six days.

Attendees play, write and record music in a [[recording studio]] alongside those from the [[music industry]], culminating in an event where attendees perform live on stage. Attendees learn song writing, receive additional instrument training, and hear from industry speakers and participate in Q&A sessions.

The event is targeted at players of any talent level, from novice to advanced.  It is geared more toward adults, with the average attendee age being between 35 and 55. Founded in 1997 by [[David Fishof]], approximately 6,000 people have thus far participated.<ref>[http://www.myfoxla.com/dpp/news/local/rock-n-roll-fantasy-camp-20100223]  {{wayback|url=http://www.myfoxla.com/dpp/news/local/rock-n-roll-fantasy-camp-20100223 |date=20120307084305 }}</ref> A [[television documentary]] series, ''Rock N' Roll Fantasy Camp'', produced by [[Mark Burnett Productions]], has aired on [[VH1 Classic]] for two seasons.<ref name="Camp 1">{{cite web|url=http://www.vh1.com/shows/rock_n_roll_fantasy_camp/series.jhtml|title=Rock N Roll Fantasy Camp » 1 » Main|publisher=VH1.com|accessdate=2014-07-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/vh1-classic-and-mark-burnett-productions-give-music-fans-a-chance-of-a-lifetime-with-new-original-series-rock-n-roll-fantasy-camp-81468067.html|title=VH1 Classic and Mark Burnett Productions Give Music Fans a Chance of a Lifetime With New Original Series 'Rock 'N' Roll Fantasy Camp'|publisher=Prnewswire.com|accessdate=2014-07-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/entertainment/tv/starr_report_I7rZEOjAK26LiurqnFYpAK|quote=The intrepid David Fishof is teaming with Mark Burnett and VH1 for a four-part series, “Rock ‘N’ Roll Fantasy Camp,” based on David’s camp (of the same name) in which everyday people perform in concert with real-life rockers|title=Starr Report|author=Michael Starr|publisher=Nypost.com|accessdate=2014-07-05|date=2010-01-15}}</ref> The "Rock and Roll Fantasy Camp All-Stars" gave a live performance at the 2009 [[Screen Actors Guild]] Post Awards Party.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.rockcamp.com/docs/people_march09.pdf|date=April 2009|journal=[[People (magazine)|People]]|title=Rock ‘N’ Roll Fantasy Camp|publisher=Rockcamp.com|accessdate=2014-07-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.rockcamp.com/docs/instyle_april09.pdf|journal=[[InStyle]]|title=Screen Writers Awards Party|publisher=Rockcamp.com|accessdate=2014-07-05}}</ref>

In addition to the camps, Rock 'n Roll Fantasy Camp also offers a team building program titled Team Rock Stars. Past clients include ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'', [[Kia Motors]], [[GE Transportation]], [[Mars, Incorporated]], [[Olympus Corporation]], ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'', and the New Jersey Society of Certified Public Accountants.{{citation needed|date=July 2014}}

title: South Witham railway station
Robert Latham Brown
content:
{{Infobox person | name = Robert Latham Brown | image = Robert_Latham_Brown_2000.jpg | imagesize= 175px | caption= Robert Brown in 2000. | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1947|6|20}} | birth_place = Alexandria, Virginia | birth_name = | spouse = }} '''Robert Latham Brown''' (born June 20, 1947) is a film producer, [[line producer]], [[production manager]], author, and teacher. In his 30-year film career, he has worked with [[Mel Brooks]], [[George Lucas]], [[Paul Verhoeven]], [[Steven Spielberg]] and many others. His expertise in budgeting and line producing inspired [[Mel Brooks]] to nickname Brown ''"Mr. On-Budget"''.''Planning the Low-Budget Film'', cover blurb. ==Biographical Information and Education== Brown was born in [[Alexandria, Virginia]], and moved to Florida with his family during his junior high school years. He attended [[Tulane University]] in [[New Orleans, Louisiana|New Orleans]] where he studied biology and was a pre-med student. At the beginning of his senior year, Brown switched his major to acting and directing in the theater. Upon receiving his Bachelor of Arts degree in 1969, Brown taught in the [[Brevard County, Florida|Brevard County]] public school system in Florida for three years. In 1972, he applied to the [[UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television]] as a master's degree candidate. When he was not accepted, Brown drove across the country and made an appointment with the Dean of the Film School. Upon learning that Brown had driven all that way to see him, the Dean promptly admitted Brown to the program based on his perseverance. Brown became the graduate teaching assistant in the beginning camera class, and counted amongst his students actor and singer [[Ed Ames]]. While at UCLA, Brown considered a career as a screenwriter and was accepted as a client at the [[William Morris Agency]]. In 1974, Brown put aside his writing career and left UCLA when he was accepted into the [[Directors Guild of America]]'s Assistant Directors Training Program. Once in the DGA, Brown rose rapidly through the ranks becoming one of the youngest production managers at [[Universal Studios]] in 1978. ==Career== As producer and production manager, Brown has worked on more than 40 feature films, including the very small (''[[Local Color (film)|Local Color]]'', ''[[The Anarchist Cookbook (film)|The Anarchist Cookbook]]'') and the very large (''[[Return of the Jedi]]'', ''[[Starship Troopers]]'', and ''[[Hollow Man (film)|Hollow Man]]''), giving him a wide range of production experience. Brown spent most of his early career at [[Universal Studios]] until ''[[The Thing (1982 film)|The Thing]]'', after which he left for [[Lucasfilm]] to work on ''[[Return of the Jedi]]'' at the invitation of [[Howard Kazanjian]]. From that point on, Brown's career has taken on a freelance aspect that has allowed him to work on an eclectic list of films and with some of the top actors in the business including [[Michael Douglas]], [[Harrison Ford]], [[Samuel L. Jackson]], and [[Kevin Bacon]]. During the filming of a scene with [[Barbra Streisand]] on ''[[All Night Long (1981 film)|All Night Long]]'' in which Streisand was playing a character who could ''not'' sing, Brown remembered, "...when we started to film that scene, she opened her mouth and this incredible voice came out. And everybody on the set just stood there with their mouths open listening to this. Then she stopped because she was supposed to be singing ''badly''....It was astounding being in the room with her."Spada, James, ''Streisand: Her Life (New York: Crown Publishers Inc., 1995), 396-397. ===Author and teacher=== Brown is also the author of the critically acclaimed book, ''[[Planning the Low-Budget Film]]'', and has been an adjunct professor at the [[University of Southern California|USC]] School of Cinematic Arts since 1996.{{cite web|url=http://cinema.usc.edu/directories/profile.cfm?id=6465&first=&last=&title=&did=50&referer=%2Fdirectories%2Ffaculty%2Ecfm&startpage=1&startrow=31cinema |title=USC Cinema – Faculty/Staff » Robert Latham Brown |publisher=Cinema.usc.edu |date= |accessdate=2012-05-13}} Additionally, Brown is a contributing writer to ''Indie Slate Magazine'', writing a series of reviews on film production software.''Indie Slate magazine'', vol. 12, Issue 55, p19. ===Writing Awards=== Brown's book, ''Planning the Low-Budget Film'' was a finalist for the 2007 Benjamin Franklin Awards,{{cite web|url=http://www.ibpa-online.org/benefits/benjamin-franklin-awards/|title=IBPA, the Independent Book Publishers Association |publisher=IBPA|date= |accessdate=2012-05-13}} and that same year was a first place winner in the Hollywood Book Festival.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodbookfestival.com/past.htm |title=Hollywood Book Festival |publisher=Hollywood Book Festival |date= |accessdate=2012-05-13}} In 2002, his screenplay ''Keats'' was named a semi-finalist in the 9th Annual Writer's Network Screenplay and Fiction Competition.{{cite web|url=http://fadeinawards.com |title=FADE IN Awards |publisher=Fadeinonline.com |date= |accessdate=2012-05-13}} ==Partial filmography== {|<-class="wikitable"-> border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 90%;" |- style="background:#b0c4de; text-align:center;" ! Year ! Film ! Credit ! Notes |- | [[1979 in film|1979]] | ''[[The Concorde ... Airport '79]]'' | Unit Production Manager | Credited as "Bob Brown." |- | rowspan="2"| [[1980 in film|1980]] | ''[[The Nude Bomb]]'' | Unit Production Manager | |- | ''[[The Blues Brothers (film)|The Blues Brothers]]'' | Unit Production Manager | |- | rowspan="3"| [[1981 in film|1981]] | ''[[All Night Long (1981 film)|All Night Long]]'' | Unit Production Manager | |- | ''[[Bustin' Loose (film)|Bustin' Loose]]'' | Unit Production Manager | |- | ''[[Ghost Story (film)|Ghost Story]]'' | Production Manager | |- | [[1982 in film|1982]] | ''[[The Thing (1982 film)|The Thing]]'' | Production Manager | Shot in the U.S. and Canada. |- | rowspan="4"| [[1983 in film|1983]] | ''[[Return of the Jedi]]'' | Production Executive | U.S. filming. |- | ''[[Iceman (1984 film)|Iceman]]'' | Production Manager | Shot in the U.S. and Canada. |- | ''[[Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom]]'' | Production Manager | U.S. filming. |- | ''[[Best Defense]]'' | Unit Production Manager | Shot in the U.S. and Israel. |- | [[1984 in film|1984]] | ''[[Goonies]]'' | Unit Production Manager | Second unit, uncredited. |- | [[1985 in film|1985]] | ''[[Warning Sign (film)|Warning Sign]]'' | Associate Producer

title: Draft:ISMGA - Indian Siddha Medical Graduates Association
content:
== '''INDIAN SIDDHA MEDICAL GRADUATES ASSOCIATION - ISMGA''' ==
       Indian Siddha Medical Graduate Association is registered by the competent authorities on 21st October 2010. The registration Number of the Association is 123/2010.  
       This Association is an amalgamation of persons who are holding the degrees, BSMS, BIM or MD (Siddha). Doctoral and post Doctoral degrees in Siddha Medicines only.
       Siddha Medical system is a Systematic Medical System in the world enumerated by our "Sidhars" who were the greatest medical scientists and therapists of the ancient times. It is Scientific, pragmatic and analytical in diagnosis, treatment and pharmacology.  The other systems of medicines may be scientific, but are not more pragmatic and analytical like the Siddha System of Medicine as the investigation of treatment of this system starts from the man and then only the external impacts that cause diseases to counter the problems for a better living. So this is the only System that believes in the principle of “Food itself is medicine” and during the period of treatment it advocates to take the food rich with iron, protein and fibre so as to prevent any nutritional disorders that may not land up in anaemic conditions.  
       In Indian system of Medicines apart from plants, herbs and flowers this system has developed a rich and unique treasure of drug knowledge in which the metals and minerals are used. The depth of this knowledge this system  enumerates in the field of metals and mineral for pharmacology , the  materia medica that can be formed and  the detailed drug classification are immense and nano scientific. 
        Hence this Association serves as the progressive platform for the transmission of this knowledge to the modern advances and latest trends. This will enable Siddha medicine and allied sciences a developing dimension in the modern medical world. This Association advocate and struggle to bring in the best utilization of this approach by the government and all Medical Institutions.
        Even if this progressive approach is achieved partially this Association reiterates that it will definitely assure an economical and an easily accessible medical care to the weaker, poorer and the marginalized. 
        We have reached a period of transition and evolution. This immense knowledge of Siddha Medicines is transferred from the caves of Pothikai Mountain to the institutionally organised Medical Institutions from where students get their degrees. So to protect the dignity and honour of the Siddha Medical Profession and Institutionally qualified persons is a matter of great importance. 
        Hence this Association will try to generate   immense opportunities in the Government welfare schemes dealing with health care for Siddha Medicine and take efforts to coordinate and communicate the important place of us in these schemes.
        In this period of transition the crop up of medico – legal problems are a matter of fact. This Association fights for the advancement and protection at all levels in a possible and viable manner and will assist all their members in all possible ways to protect their rights. 
         And their motto is "'''JOIN TOGETHER BE STRONG FOREVER'''". This association has more than 1000 siddha medical graduates as its members.

content:
:''The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.'' The result was '''delete'''. I see a [[wp:rough consensus|rough consensus]] to delete. Some of the keep comments appeared to rely on arguments that have been generally accepted as unpersuasive, and I weighed those accordingly. In general, the subject seems to be on the cusp of notability, but not there yet. If asked, I will be happy to place a copy of this article in user space so it can be improved. [[User:Xymmax|Xymmax]] [[User_talk:Xymmax|So let it be written]] [[Special:Contributions/Xymmax|So let it be done]] 02:53, 5 September 2009 (UTC) Put it in user space then. Another article or two and this'll be good to go. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Vincent Pace|Vincent Pace]] ([[User talk:Vincent Pace|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Vincent Pace|contribs]]) 01:13, 6 September 2009 (UTC) ===[[Steve Kaufmann]]=== :{{la|Steve Kaufmann}} ([{{fullurl:Steve Kaufmann|wpReason={{urlencode: [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Steve Kaufmann]]}}&action=delete}} delete]) – ([[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Steve Kaufmann|View AfD]])([[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Log/2009 August 29#{{anchorencode:Steve Kaufmann}}|View log]]) :({{findsources|Steve Kaufmann}}) Although impressive number of languages known, their are no GNEWS beyond press releases and GHits consist mainly of blogs and book references. Appears to fail [[WP:BIO]]. [[User:Ttonyb1| ttonyb1]] ([[User talk:Ttonyb1#top|talk]]) 00:47, 29 August 2009 (UTC) :'''Comment''' - Wrong. Here's Google News on Steve Kaufmann: http://news.google.com/archivesearch?pz=1&ned=us&hl=en&q=%22steve+kaufmann%22+language&cf=all. About 2/3 of the relevant articles are valid Canadian press coverage. Passes [[WP:BIO]]. Moreover, why is Google News the arbiter of notoriety. Google News doesn't get everything: http://www.blogtalkradio.com/bcradio/2009/03/05/BC-Radio-Live. What's more, if I start listing out language-learning blogs on which he's featured or discussed, the list will get really long. Should I? "A person is presumed to be notable if he or she has been the subject of published[3] secondary source material which is reliable, intellectually independent,[4] and independent of the subject.[5] :If the depth of coverage is not substantial, then multiple independent sources may be needed to prove notability; trivial coverage of a subject by secondary sources may not be sufficient to establish notability." Steve's got extensive blog coverage backed up by media coverage, backed up by primary sources, so that seems to be pretty easily met. In addition, under the "Any Bio" guidelines, Steve has won significant awards in language blogging (indeed, the significant award in language blogging) and his views on language learning have had an enduring affect on the field. [[User:Vincent Pace| Vincent Pace]] ([[User talk:Vincent Pace#top|talk]]) 02:40, 29 August 2009 (UTC) :*'''Comment''' – I looked at the same “news” articles before I nominated the article for AfD. Here is what I found: ::Items 1,2 and, 3 — are press releases and are not really independent sources. ::Items 4,5, and 6 — are the same article and Kaufmann is only briefly quoted in the article. ::Item 7 — is not available. ::Item 8 — is only a mention of where he will be speaking. ::Item 9 — is not about the subject, but rather talks about basketball players. ::Item 10 — Is not about the right Kaufmann. :A couple of additional comments, Google News is ''only one'' indicator of [[WP:BIO|Notability]], there are many factors that can be involved; and third party blogs are not considered to be reliable support for BLP. My best to you... [[User:Ttonyb1| ttonyb1]] ([[User talk:Ttonyb1#top|talk]]) 04:09, 29 August 2009 (UTC) *'''Note''': This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Language|list of Language-related deletion discussions]]. -- [[User:Ron Ritzman|Ron Ritzman]] ([[User talk:Ron Ritzman|talk]]) 02:22, 29 August 2009 (UTC) *'''Note''': This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Authors|list of Authors-related deletion discussions]]. -- [[User:Ron Ritzman|Ron Ritzman]] ([[User talk:Ron Ritzman|talk]]) 02:23, 29 August 2009 (UTC) *'''Weak Delete''' The best source seems to be the Windsor Star article, and it seems to be a noncritical feature based upon a PR interview. [http://www.canada.com/windsorstar/news/business/story.html?id=5fcf1664-2f8d-41a4-9e73-4f045c7f07f5] Though a significant regional paper, I am reluctant to consider such accounts reliable for notability. '''[[User:DGG| DGG]]''' ([[User talk:DGG| talk ]]) 04:24, 29 August 2009 (UTC) *'''Delete''' for lack of notability. Subject does not seem to meet [[WP:PROF|"the professor test"]], and the preponderance of primary sources on the page and passing references noted above suggest that he doesn't meet the [[WP:BIO|notability guidelines for people]]. Neither of his blogs, The Linguist on Language or LingQ, appear to meet [[WP:WEB|the notability guide for websites]], either. I can't find a review of his book, and neither can [http://books.google.com/books?id=Dpv0mJZ6mUoC&sitesec=reviews Google Books]. [[User:Cnilep|Cnilep]] ([[User talk:Cnilep|talk]]) 15:40, 29 August 2009 (UTC) :*'''Keep''' – Amazon is probably just as reliable or unreliable as Wikipedia, but I found three [http://www.amazon.com/Way-Linguist-Language-Learning-Odyssey/product-reviews/1420873296/ref=cm_cr_dp_all_helpful?ie=UTF8&coliid=&showViewpoints=1&colid=&sortBy=bySubmissionDateDescending reviews] [[User:Plumflower|Plumflower]] ([[User talk:Plumflower|talk]]) 23:56, 29 August 2009 (UTC) {{spa|Plumflower}} :*'''Keep''' – There is some coverage - see [http://www.google.se/search?hl=sv&safe=off&q=steve+kaufmann&meta= Google]. Please Google around instead of blatantly deleting the entry. [[User:Plumflower|Plumflower]] ([[User talk:Plumflower|talk]]) 15:12, 30 August 2009 (UTC) {{spa|Plumflower}} :'''Keep''' - Doesn't this bio also make it as an author? [[WP:Author]] He's certainly widely cited by his peers, and there are strong argument in other factors as well. In addition, more press coverage is available here: http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/fl20080705a1.html, http://www.japantoday.com/category/executive-impact/view/youre-never-too-old-to-learn-a-new-language, http://media.thelinguist.com/media/2008/03/19_radio1.mp3 (interview with Radio Canada in French), http://media.thelinguist.com/media/2008/EnglishLingQ/208_cest_lavie.mp3 (interview with Radio Canada in English) (haven't tracked down these yet on Radio Canada) [[User:Vincent Pace| Vincent Pace]] ([[User talk:Vincent Pace#top|talk]]) 16:06, 30 August 2009 (UTC) :*I've not actually seen any citations of his work by his peers, and the two links to thelinguist.com are not independent of the subject. But, the pieces in the Japan Times and Japan Today contribute to borderline [[WP:GNG]] notability. Two pieces is not quite enough for me to call ''significant'', but more similar pieces might win me over. (Looking again, the Japan Today piece reads more like a press release than reliable news coverage. The Japan Times piece is better, though it is a feature.) [[User:Cnilep|Cnilep]] ([[User talk:Cnilep|talk]]) 17:27, 1 September 2009 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

title: Ivan Morozov
content:
[[Image:Ivan Abramovich Morozov.jpg|thumb|Ivan Abramovich Morozov]]

'''Ivan Morozov''' (Ивáн Абрáмович Морóзов, November 27, 1871 – July 21, 1921) was a Russian businessman and from 1907 to 1914 a major collector of avant-garde French art.

After the [[October Revolution|Bolshevik Revolution]] his art collection was nationalized and divided between the [[Pushkin Museum]], [[Moscow]], and the [[Hermitage Museum]], [[Saint Petersburg|Leningrad]].

'''Albertin Montoya''' (born 19 February 1975) is a retired [[United States|American]] [[association football|soccer]] [[midfielder]] who spent two seasons with the [[San Jose Clash]].  He was the head coach of [[United States women's national under-17 soccer team]] from 2011 to 2012.  He is married to [[Erin Martinez]], a former player in the [[Women's United Soccer Association]] and alumnus of Santa Clara.

In 1995, Montoya played for the [[San Francisco Seals (soccer)|San Francisco United All Blacks]] in the [[USISL Premier League]].<ref>[http://www.sfgate.com/sports/article/All-Blacks-drop-close-semifinal-to-Richmond-3137324.php All Blacks drop close semifinal to Richmond]</ref>

title: Charles Hanlon
content:
[[File:Oregon state senator Charles Hanlon.png|200px|right]]
'''Charles J. Hanlon''' (September 15, 1918 – September 9, 1990) was the first [[independent (politics)|independent]] member of the U.S. state of Oregon's [[Oregon Legislative Assembly|legislature]] elected in 50 years,<ref name=BulletinObit>{{cite news|title=Charles Hanson succumbs to cancer|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=blBYAAAAIBAJ&sjid=wIYDAAAAIBAJ&pg=2375,1418767&dq=72nd+oregon+legislature&hl=en|work=The Bend Bulletin|date=September 11, 1990}}</ref> and the fifth in Oregon history.<ref name=Bulletin76>{{cite news|first=Jim|last=Church|publisher=The Associated Press|title=Independent backs Boe to lead Senate|work=The Bend Bulletin|date=June 24, 1976|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=wfpXAAAAIBAJ&sjid=vPYDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6606,2384550&dq=charles-hanlon+oregon&hl=en}}</ref> He served three terms in the [[Oregon Senate]], from 1976 to 1986.

He became a [[Democratic Party of Oregon|Democrat]] after his first election, in which he defeated the then-Senate Majority Leader, Democrat [[William Holmstrom]].<ref name=BulletinObit /> ''[[The Oregonian]]'s'' obituary stated that he was known for his independence throughout his career, noting his opposition to the timber industry's influence on forest management and, specifically, the [[Oregon Board of Forestry]],<ref>{{cite news|author=unsigned editorial|title=Make state forestry board advisory|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=GxBWAAAAIBAJ&sjid=TuIDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6329,8055950&dq=charles-hanlon+oregon&hl=en|work=Eugene Register-Guard|date=January 31, 1981}}</ref> and his efforts to legalize self-service gasoline in the state.<ref name=Oobit>{{cite news|first=Jeff|last=Mapes|title=Former state sen. Charles Hanlon dies|work=The Oregonian|date=September 11, 1990}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Self-service gas station bill defeated|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=KaNVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JeADAAAAIBAJ&pg=6744,3239131&dq=charles-hanlon+oregon&hl=en|accessdate=27 October 2012|newspaper=Eugene Register-Guard|date=May 12, 1977}}</ref> In 1977, he proposed an amendment to the state constitution that would have added two years to House and Senate terms, and imposed a [[term limit]] of 12 years.<ref>[http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=STBYAAAAIBAJ&sjid=7PYDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6626,1576207&dq=charles-hanlon+oregon&hl=en The Bulletin - Google News Archive Search<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Hanlon was also noted for his constituent services, including a successful effort to force a state [[barber]]'s licensing board to administer an oral exam to an illiterate barber.<ref name=Oobit />

==Life==
Hanlon was born in [[Pennsylvania]] and raised by an aunt. He served in the [[United States Army]] in [[World War II]], and subsequently moved to [[Ventura, California]], where he was an executive for a sand and gravel company. He moved to Oregon in 1958, where he raised cattle and hay on Buck Mountain near [[Cornelius, Oregon|Cornelius]]. He ran for office as an independent, but at the urging of the Republican party, after Holmstrom, who had already secured both the Democratic and Republican nominations for reelection, was accused of ethical misconduct. He chaired committees including revenue, rules, transportation, and agriculture,<ref name=Oobit /> and served a term as president pro tempore in 1985.<ref name=BulletinObit />

Hanlon represented a district including the city of [[Gearhart, Oregon|Gearhart]].<ref name=BulletinObit /> He launched a petition drive to pass an [[open primary]] amendment to the [[Oregon Constitution]] in 1975.<ref>[http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=K9ZVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JuADAAAAIBAJ&pg=5257,7325164&dq=charles-hanlon+oregon&hl=en Eugene Register-Guard - Google News Archive Search<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He first announced he would join the Democratic party in June 1976, bolstering [[Jason Boe]]'s effort to overcome fellow Democrat [[Betty Roberts]]'s challenge to his position as Senate president. Hanlon, who had been a registered Democrat two decades prior, said the Senate presidency issue prompted his decision to rejoin the party, though he had been considering it for some time. At the time, ''[[The Bend Bulletin]]'' stated that he was considered one of the most knowledgeable legislators on the subject of [[natural resources]]. He denied that his move was motivated by political gamesmanship, stating that his desire to be appointed chair of a committee was unrelated to joining the party; and he asserted his intention to remain independent, and critical of the two-party system.<ref name=Bulletin76 />

Hanlon defeated Holmstrom a second time in 1978, and Representative [[Ted Bugas]] in 1982.<ref name=Oobit /> He was succeeded in his district by [[Joan Dukes]], who said that Hanlon was always more interested in doing what was right, than in doing what was politically expedient.<ref name=Oobit /> In 1983, he was known for supporting a state [[sales tax]] proposal opposed by Senate President [[Edward Fadeley]]. According to the ''Oregonian's'' obituary, his frustrations over that issue led him to announce his retirement following the session;<ref name=Oobit /> his comments at the time, however, indicated frustration with the time demands of a job that is intended to be part-time.<ref>[http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=t49TAAAAIBAJ&sjid=nYYDAAAAIBAJ&pg=4940,4525559&dq=charles-hanlon+oregon&hl=en The Bulletin - Google News Archive Search<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=tV0hAAAAIBAJ&sjid=A4YFAAAAIBAJ&pg=4383,2608413&dq=charles-hanlon+oregon&hl=en Tri City Herald - Google News Archive Search<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He reversed the decision to resign and served out the remainder of his term.

Hanlon died of cancer in Salem, Oregon on September 9, 1990; he was survived by his wife Neila and two children.<ref name=BulletinObit />

== References ==

title: Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Wilderness engineering
content:
:''The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.'' The result was '''redirect to [[Rewilding]]'''. Any useful content can be merged from the page history. [[User:Timotheus Canens|T. Canens]] ([[User talk:Timotheus Canens|talk]]) 02:17, 21 August 2015 (UTC) ===[[Wilderness engineering]]=== :{{la|Wilderness engineering}} – ([[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Wilderness engineering|View AfD]][[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Log/2015 August 13#{{anchorencode:Wilderness engineering}}|View log]]{{int:dot-separator}} [https://tools.wmflabs.org/jackbot/snottywong/cgi-bin/votecounter.cgi?page=Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Wilderness_engineering Stats]) :({{Find sources AFD|Wilderness engineering}}) Appears to be a made up term verging on [[WP:NEO]] and self promotion. Can't find much about this on the web appears to beyond what the author has created - most of the 221 Google hits are for a company with the same name. Maybe redirecting to [[Rewilding]] would be appropriate. [[User:reddogsix|reddogsix]] ([[User talk:reddogsix#top|talk]]) 19:29, 30 July 2015 (UTC) *'''Merge''' with [[Rewilding]]. That is the more established term and they seem to be the same thing. [[User:Borock|Borock]] ([[User talk:Borock|talk]]) 20:33, 30 July 2015 (UTC) *'''Keep''' [[Wilderness engineering]] should be kept as a separate entity from [[Rewilding]] as they are two two distinct forms of conservation! [[Rewilding]] seeks to leave nature to its own in order for nature to "restore itself", while [[Wilderness engineering]] seeks to restore a lost ecosystem by means of manual recreation (be that replanting an entire forest of introducing seemingly exotic ecological equivalents of lost fauna)! [[User:Jason-Luiz_Mendez]] ([[User talk:Jason-Luiz_Mendez|talk]]) 13:41, 3 August 2015 (CET) {{spa|Jason-Luiz_Mendez}} :*'''Comment''' - What you fail to address is the article lacks support and notability. Additionally, the article is self promotion for the author. [[User:reddogsix|reddogsix]] ([[User talk:reddogsix#top|talk]]) 14:02, 3 August 2015 (UTC) :Note: This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Environment|list of Environment-related deletion discussions]]. [[User:Gene93k|• Gene93k]] ([[User talk:Gene93k|talk]]) 13:55, 1 August 2015 (UTC) :Note: This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/Science|list of Science-related deletion discussions]]. [[User:Gene93k|• Gene93k]] ([[User talk:Gene93k|talk]]) 13:55, 1 August 2015 (UTC)
'''{{resize|91%|[[Wikipedia:Deletion process#Relisting discussions|Relisted]] to generate a more thorough discussion and clearer consensus.}}'''
Please add new comments below this notice. Thanks, [[User:Jaaron95|'''JAaron95''']] [[User talk:Jaaron95|Talk]] 12:37, 6 August 2015 (UTC)
*'''delete''' The term "wilderness engineering" more or less belongs to the Boy Scouts: do a GBook search and you will get a lot of hits on ''[[Boys Life]]'' articles mixed in with a bunch of accidental juxtapositions. This article's use is a neologism which is manifestly promotional. [[User:Seyasirt|Seyasirt]] ([[User talk:Seyasirt|talk]]) 16:31, 6 August 2015 (UTC)
'''{{resize|91%|[[Wikipedia:Deletion process#Relisting discussions|Relisted]] to generate a more thorough discussion and clearer consensus.}}'''
Please add new comments below this notice. Thanks, [[WP:☮|☮]][[User:Jaaron95|'''JAaron95''']] [[User talk:Jaaron95|Talk]] 17:56, 13 August 2015 (UTC)
*'''Merge''' any substantial content with [[Rewilding]]. This is even the term used in the article.[[User:Pincrete|Pincrete]] ([[User talk:Pincrete|talk]]) 14:30, 15 August 2015 (UTC) {{clear}} :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

title: Wikipedia:WikiProject Physics/Missing physics topics/24
Count of Wylich and Lottum
content:
'''Count of Wylich and Lottum''' (German:''Graf von Wylich und Lottum'') may refer to:

*[[Carl Philipp, Reichsgraf von Wylich und Lottum]] (1650–1719), a Prussian field marshal
*[[Johann Christoph, Graf von Wylich und Lottum]] (1681–1727), a Prussian major-general
*[[Friedrich Wilhelm, Graf von Wylich und Lottum]] (1716–1774), a Prussian major-general, commandant of Berlin
*[[Friedrich Albrecht Karl Herrmann, Reichsgraf von Wylich und Lottum]] (1720–1797)  a Prussian general of cavalry
*[[Heinrich Christoph Karl Herrmann, Reichsgraf von Wylich und Lottum]] (1773–1830), a Prussian major-general fought in the Napoleonic Wars including the Waterloo Campaign 
*[[Carl Friedrich Heinrich, Graf von Wylich und Lottum]] (1767–1841), a Prussian infantry general and minister of state
*[[Wilhelm Carl Gustav Malte, Reichsgraf von Wylich und Lottum]]  (1833–1907), in 1861 after the death of the last male member of the [[House of Putbus]] in the male line, he became ''Wilhelm Malte II, Prince of Putbus''
==See also==
[[:de:Wylich und Lottum]] – an article on the German Wikipedia about this family

{{dab}}

title: User talk:Venkat888
content: ==Welcome== Hello, '''Venkat888''', and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia. Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/Venkat888|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. If you are stuck, and looking for help, please come to the '''[[Wikipedia:Teahouse/Questions|Wikipedia Teahouse]]''', where experienced Wikipedians can answer any queries you have! Or, you can just type '''{{helpme}}''' and your question on this page, and someone will show up shortly to answer. Here are a few good links for newcomers: * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The Five Pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Editing tutorial]] * [[Wikipedia:Picture tutorial|Picture tutorial]] * [[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] * [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions|Naming conventions]] * [[Wikipedia:Simplified Manual of Style|Simplified Manual of Style]] * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedia Signpost|Discover what's going on in the Wikimedia community]] We hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! By the way, you can sign your name on talk and vote pages using four tildes, like this: ~~~~. If you have any questions, see the [[Wikipedia:Help|help pages]], add a question to the [[Wikipedia:Village pump|village pump]] or ask me on my talk page. Again, welcome! -- [[User talk:TheRedPenOfDoom|TRPoD aka The Red Pen of Doom]] 18:27, 19 October 2014 (UTC) == October 2014 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|alt=|link=]] Hello, I'm [[User:BracketBot|BracketBot]]. title: Charles Evans Hughes III
content:
{{dablink|For other persons of the same name see [[Charles Evans Hughes]] (1862–1948) and [[Charles Evans Hughes, Jr.]] (1889–1950)}}
{{Refimprove|date=December 2007}}
{{Infobox architect

'''Charles Evans Hughes III''' (March 14, 1915 – January 7, 1985) was an [[United States|American]] [[architect]].

==Biography==
Hughes was the grandson of Chief Justice and 1916 [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] [[President of the United States|presidential]] nominee [[Charles Evans Hughes]] and the son of [[Charles Evans Hughes, Jr.]], who served as [[United States Solicitor General]], 1929 and 1930 under President [[Herbert Hoover]]. Hughes' younger brother [[H. Stuart Hughes|Stuart]] was a renowned historian who was noted for antiwar activities during the [[Vietnam War]]. As a young man, Hughes attended [[Deerfield Academy]] and [[Brown University]], and later the [[Harvard Graduate School of Design]]. In [[World War II]], Hughes served as the gunnery officer in [[USS Mullany (DD-528)|USS ''Mullaney'']] (DD-528).

Hughes was a resident of [[Riverdale, Bronx]], [[New York]].<ref>Goldberger, Paul. [http://select.nytimes.com/search/restricted/article?res=F00E15FB3D5F0C738DDDA80894DD484D81 "CHARLES E. HUGHES 3D DEAD; LEADER IN BANK ARCHITECTURE"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', January 10, 1985. Accessed May 4, 2008. "Mr. Hughes, who lived in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, was the grandson of Charles Evans Hughes, the former Chief Justice of the United States."</ref>

title: User:One-dimensional Tangent/myskin.css
Otto Witte
content:
'''Otto Witte''' (October 16, 1872 – August 13, 1958) was a [[Germans|German]] circus acrobat and fantasist who said that he managed to be crowned [[King of Albania]].

[[File:Otto Witte Gravesite.jpg|thumb|Otto Witte's grave in Ohlsdorf Cemetery, Hamburg]]

In 1913, when [[Albania]] broke away from the [[Ottoman Empire]], some [[Islam in Albania|Albanian Muslims]] invited [[Halim Eddine]], a nephew of the [[Sultan]], to come and be crowned king.  Noticing his own resemblance to Halim Eddine, Witte said, he traveled to [[Durrës]] with a friend, the [[sword swallowing|sword-swallower]] Max Schlepsig.  He claimed that he had succeeded in being crowned king by the local troops on 13 August 1913. He also claimed that, over the next five days, he enjoyed a [[harem]] and declared war on [[Montenegro]] before his ruse was discovered.  His claims also include that he took a substantial portion of the kingdom's treasury,<ref>Jean-Pierre Bellemare (dir.), ''Les Génies de l'arnaque'', Albin Michel, 1994.</ref> and along with Schlepsig he managed to escape the palace with the aid of the harem, and eventually made their way out of the country.

Most parts of his story were found to be impossible. There was no Halim Eddine and the Sultan [[Abdul Hamid II]]'s son Burhan Eddine, who was offered the throne in 1914, never came; he may be the model for this story.  Originally he claimed this escapade happened in February 1913, when Albania was still under [[Serbia]]n occupation, so he changed the date to August 1913.{{Citation needed|date=September 2007}} There is no local evidence to support his claims. Nevertheless, he became famous in Germany for his public appearance. The [[Berlin]] police later allowed his official [[identity card]] to bear the artistic [[pseudonym]] ''ehemaliger König von Albanien'' ("former King of Albania"). For the rest of his life he insisted on being greeted with that title, and it was put on his tombstone at [[Ohlsdorf Cemetery]], Hamburg (Parzelle Q 9, 430–433).

He may have suffered from [[pseudologia fantastica]]{{Citation needed|date=September 2007}}; for example, he claimed to have founded a [[political party]].  He said he was a candidate for the [[president of Germany|German presidency]] in 1925, gaining 25,000 to 230,000 votes in the first round but resigning in favour of [[Paul von Hindenburg]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2007}} The voting records do not support this either. 

Interest in Albania was high in the German-speaking world because the [[Great Powers]] had chosen a German prince to sit on the throne.  [[William, Prince of Albania|William of Wied]] was approached for the job in 1913 and ruled for six months in 1914.<ref name =Heaton-Armstrong>{{cite book| last =Heaton-Armstrong| first =Duncan| title =The Six Month Kingdom: Albania 1914| publisher =I.B.Tauris| year =2005| isbn =1-85043-761-0| nopp =true }}</ref>  The similarity in name between Wied and Witte may have inspired Witte to make up the story.{{Citation needed|date=August 2011}}

Otto Witte's story was adapted by [[Harry Turtledove]] for his [[fantasy novel]] ''[[Every Inch a King]]''.  Witte's story bears a strong resemblance to the best-selling [[adventure novel]] ''[[The Prisoner of Zenda]]'' (1894), of which the first [[film adaptation]] was released in 1913.  The central concept of ''Zenda'' is a commoner being mistaken for a king, and assuming his place.

Various newspapers and magazines took Otto's story as fact and repeated it, including ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine, which published an article about his tale in 1958.

==References==
{{reflist}}

==External links==
* [http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,868723,00.html The Man Who Was King], ''[[Time (magazine)|Time magazine]]'', 25 August 1958, retrieved from ''Time Magazine Archive'' on 12 March 2007
* [http://www.ansichtskarten-pankow.de/witte.htm Otto Witte from Pankow], pictures and postcards. (German)
* [http://homepages.compuserve.de/fmatth01/Ohlsdorf/Otto_Witte.htm Otto Witte's gravestone in Hamburg] (German)
* [http://marjorie-art.site.voila.fr/Otto1.htm Biographical details], in French, with photograph.

title: Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Frank Fellows Gray
content: :''The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.'' The result was '''keep.''' The main problem that was expressed in this discussion was that the article lacked notability and verifiability due to the lack of coverage in reliable, third party sources. In response, a couple users provided sources to the point where the problems expressed by deletion !votes had been addressed to, to at least some extent (for example, it has been verified that Gray was one of the early founders of the Boy Scouts in the United States). As a result, as was pointed out by the succeeding comment and keep !vote, a certain level of notability and verifiability was established. Non-admin closure. ~[[User:SuperHamster|Super]][[User:SuperHamster|Hamster]] [[User talk:SuperHamster|Talk]] [[Special:Contributions/SuperHamster|Contribs]] 04:38, 24 July 2010 (UTC) ===[[Frank Fellows Gray]]=== :{{la|Frank Fellows Gray}} – ([[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Frank Fellows Gray|View AfD]][[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Log/2010 July 16#{{anchorencode:Frank Fellows Gray}}|View log]]{{•}} {{plainlink|1=http://toolserver.org/~betacommand/cgi-bin/afdparser?afd={{urlencode:Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Frank Fellows Gray}}|2=AfD statistics}}) :({{Find sources|Frank Fellows Gray}}) Delete, lack of sources to back up claim doing a google news archive search found only one mention [[http://news.google.com/archivesearch?as_user_ldate=1890&as_user_hdate=2010&q=%22Frank+Fellows+Gray%22&scoring=a&q=%22Frank+Fellows+Gray%22&lnav=od&btnG=Go]] [[User:Hell in a Bucket|Hell In A Bucket]] ([[User talk:Hell in a Bucket|talk]]) 15:44, 16 July 2010 (UTC) RATIONALE FOR INCLUSION I commend and respect your careful watching of pages but I think his notability is reflected in his actual accomplishments, recognition by BSA at their 25th Anniversary (1935), the unique and singular designation of Troop 4 Montclair as THE WORLDS ONLY "Baden Powell Troop", the naming of an almost 100 year old camp for him from the outset (now Bergen County Park) which people might reasonably expect Wikipedia to enlighten them about (the Camp is referenced elsewhere in Wikipedia). There may be some rationale I am missing why news is the criteria for Google search but more broadly here are credible confirmations: Here are the links that demonstrate this: '''Yale University''': http://yufind.library.yale.edu/yufind/Record/2657069 notes him as author '''FindAGrave''': http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=55011492 read the picture of his monmument. '''Glen Gray''': http://www.glengray.org/75.html note BSA Plaque '''Newark Star Ledger''': http://www.glengray.org/fogg/NewsArticles/StarLedger2-6-02.htm $5M for the camp and kept his name on it! 2002 '''NYNJCT Botany Website''': http://www.nynjctbotany.org/njhltofc/glengray.html confirms his 1917 founding of the Camp. '''Syracuse University''': http://books.google.com/books?id=O8IVAQAAIAAJ&pg=PA844&lpg=PA844&dq=%22frank+fellows+gray%22&source=bl&ots=ad0BtzBSNQ&sig=WI-pY7Vv4dEgXBDM5J-Km2erKG8&hl=en&ei=nIxATM6fKsG78gasysiZDw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=6&ved=0CCMQ6AEwBQ Google books scan confirms his attendance there and Phi Delta Theta Membership I believe all of these meet the Wikipedia standard for inclusion and will allow other scholars to amend, add or correct any errors. I am not associated with Glen Gray past or present (hope to visit someday). Just a missing piece of NJ and Scout history that should be accessible to everyone so they do not have to scrounge around the internet like I did to assemble the article. [[User:Dalcrow|Dalcrow]] ([[User talk:Dalcrow|talk]]) 16:57, 16 July 2010 (UTC) :Thank you for understanding my reasoning I did not see those references when I had searched so I can understand your rationale. I am not opposed to '''withdrawing''' considering the circumstances. [[User:Hell in a Bucket|Hell In A Bucket]] ([[User talk:Hell in a Bucket|talk]]) 17:05, 16 July 2010 (UTC) :No problem - got out my digital copy of In The Dark and playing Touch of Grey for us and Mr. Gray! Miss Jerry too! Will wait to see if others chime in. [[User:Dalcrow|Dalcrow]] ([[User talk:Dalcrow|talk]]) 17:32, 16 July 2010 (UTC) *'''Note''': This debate has been included in the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Deletion sorting/People|list of People-related deletion discussions]]. -- [[User:Gene93k|• Gene93k]] ([[User talk:Gene93k|talk]]) 03:00, 17 July 2010 (UTC) *'''Weak Delete''' - the article makes claims that, if confirmed, would be grounds for notability (i.e. that he founded the first Scout troop in the United States). Unfortunately, it's not very well referenced at the moment - most of the information here is only supported by non-independent sources (i.e. the Glen Gray website). If better references to third-party sources can't be found, I have to conclude the subject of the article is not notable. [[User:Robofish|Robofish]] ([[User talk:Robofish|talk]]) 14:29, 17 July 2010 (UTC) *'''References Added''' - added four references confirming some of the key elements for notability. Anyone who does not appreciate the level of effort Wikipedia Editors apply to each article has not tried to write one! Keep up the good work. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Dalcrow|Dalcrow]] ([[User talk:Dalcrow|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Dalcrow|contribs]]) 14:48, 18 July 2010 (UTC) *'''Keep''' Refs establish notability. [[User:Lionelt|Lionel]] ([[User talk:Lionelt|talk]]) 05:22, 20 July 2010 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

'''Šarkamen''' ({{lang-sr-cyr|Шаркамен}}) is a settlement situated in eastern [[Serbia]], in the [[Negotin]] municipality of the [[Bor District]]. It is inhabited by 369 people, with a Serb majority (98,66%)
<!-- Coordinates: 44°14'57"N   22°21'7"E -->
==History==
===Roman===
The town houses an archaeological site known as ''Vrelo Šarkamen'', spanning an area of 25 hectares.<ref name=Glas>http://arhiva.glas-javnosti.rs/arhiva/2005/03/17/srpski/K05031603.shtml</ref>
A Roman resident/memorial complex with a mausoleum on the slopes of [[Deli Jovan]] was built during the [[tetrarchy]] (early 4th century), of which today only ruins exist.<ref>http://www.denzor.co.rs/sarkamen_en.html</ref> The complex was discovered by [[Dragoslav Srejović]]. The mausoleum is dated to 293-311,<ref name=Glas/> and is dedicated to the mother of Emperor [[Maximinus Daia]], who was born nearby<!-- and nearly finished it-->.<ref>http://books.google.com/?id=HAmc0fBGoxUC</ref> Notable imperial gold jewelry has been found, including a golden ring of the Emperor's mother.<ref name=Glas/>

title: Polynesian triller
content:
{{Taxobox
| name = Polynesian triller
| image = Lalage maculosa close up.jpg
| status = LC
| status_system = IUCN3.1
| status_ref = <ref>{{IUCN|id=22706681 |title=''Lalage maculosa'' |assessors=[[BirdLife International]] |version=2013.2 |year=2012 |accessdate=26 November 2013}}</ref>
| regnum = [[Animal]]ia
| phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]]
| classis = [[bird|Aves]]
| ordo = [[Passeriformes]]
| familia = [[Campephagidae]]
| genus = ''[[Lalage (genus)|Lalage]]''
| species = '''''L. maculosa'''''
| binomial = ''Lalage maculosa''
| binomial_authority = ([[Titian Peale|Peale]], 1848)
}}
The '''Polynesian triller''' (''Lalage maculosa'') is a [[passerine]] [[bird]] belonging to the [[triller (bird)|triller]] genus ''Lalage'' in the [[cuckoo-shrike]] family Campephagidae. It has numerous [[subspecies]] distributed across the islands of the south-west [[Pacific]].

It is 15 to 16 cm long. The plumage varies geographically; some populations are contrastingly black and white while others have more grey or brown coloration.

It is a noisy bird with a nasal, rasping call. The [[bird song|song]] is short and high-pitched.

The breeding range extends through [[Fiji]], [[Samoa]], [[Tonga]], [[Niue]], [[Wallis and Futuna]], [[Vanuatu]] and the [[Santa Cruz Islands]]. It occurs in a wide variety of habitats including man-made habitats such as plantations and gardens. It feeds on insects such as [[caterpillar]]s and also feeds on fruit.

The cup-shaped [[nest]] is placed in the fork of a tree branch. One or two [[egg (biology)|eggs]] are laid; these are greenish with brown blotches.

[[Image:Polytriller abaca jun07.JPG|thumb|250px|left|ssp ''pumila'', Abaca, Viti Levu, Fiji Isles]]
[[Image:Polytriller savusavu jun08.JPG|thumb|250px|left|ssp ''woodi'', Savusavu,Vanua Levu, Fiji Isles]]
[[Image:Polytriller taveuni jun08.JPG|thumb|250px|left|ssp ''woodi'', Matei, Taveuni, Fiji Isles]]

{{commons category|Lalage maculosa}}
{{wikispecies|Lalage maculosa}}

==References==
{{Reflist}}
*Bregulla, Heinrich L. (1992) ''Birds of Vanuatu'', Anthony Nelson, Oswestry, England.
*Pratt, H. Douglas; Bruner, Philip L. & Berrett, Delwyn G. (1987), ''A Field Guide to the Birds of Hawaii and the Tropical Pacific'', Princeton University Press, Chichester.

title: User talk:Ponn~enwiki
content:
== Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Ponn. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Ponn~enwiki that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. If you think you might own all of the accounts with this name and this message is in error, please visit [[Special:MergeAccount]] to check and attach all of your accounts to prevent them from being renamed. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
02:27, 20 March 2015 (UTC) == Renamed ==

title: User:Purkinje42
content:
Zoology undergrad at St Andrews University in Scotland, after having studied pharmacy for 4 painful years in Athens, Greece. I live in Dundee and occasionally work for the university's events office. I am often involved with public engagement activities with local wildlife groups.

Co-founder of the [http://dundee.skepticsinthepub.org/ Dundee Skeptics] group, hosting monthly [[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skeptics_in_the_Pub Skeptics in the Pub]] events.
